Master Answer:
A blood test to confirm immunity to (protection against) the hepatitis B virus is not routinely recommended when there has been a delay between vaccine doses. A longer than recommended interval between doses of the hepatitis B vaccine does not result in reduced protection once all the recommended doses have been received, regardless of the amount of time that has passed between doses. 
Immunization Nurse
Master Question: My first two Hep B shots were on schedule, but my third was many years later. Should I get a blood test to check for immunity, or is a long break between the second and third ok?
Master Question variation 0: when do i have to break between the second shot and third
Master Question variation 1: when between shots should you get blood test
Master Question variation 2: what test should you test to check for immunity
